results.title: Western Australia: the search for oil
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the first operational stage of the search for oil at Exmouth Gulf (WA) including the seismograph party making exploratory drillings and echo soundings with explosives. (Explains the principle of this method with diagrams.) A highlight is the building of the large derrick before drilling for oil began.

results.title: Western Australia's moving memories...
results.creator_credit: Paul D. Barron, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Glenda Hambly
results.brief_description: Picnic parties, picture shows and promenading. Festivities, fashions and frontiers. Living in the first half of this century in Western Australia had an elegance even in the hardships of its isolation and pioneer lifestyle. Watch Perth grow into a capital city and centre of commerce. Its streets and suburbs flourishing around the Swan River. Travel to rural centres where the whole community gathers to watch a race and to its frontier towns where gold is the currency of life and death. See everyday life as sheep are dipped, cattle are paraded at the Agricultural Show, and people picnic at the zoo, frolic on the beaches and run errands down the street. Made up of rare archival footage from Western Australian sources and from the National Film and Sound Archive this fascinating video includes newsreels, documentaries, and actuality footage from 1902 to 1952.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul D. Barron, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Glenda Hambly

results.title: Western Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Experience the highlights of Western Australia beginning with the wildlife and good food at Margaret River, visit the Pinnacles, enjoy a range of sporting activities at Merribrook, join a cattle muster at El Questro or a novelty gypsy caravan tour, explore the Spanish architecture at New Norcia - the country town built to bring christianity to the Aborigines, visit the Pilbara and picturesque Broome or board a yacht to explore remote sections of Western Australia’s spectacular coastline.

results.brief_description: Combines locational footage with personal reminiscences of growing up in Northcote. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.

results.title: West wind: the story of Tom Thomson
results.brief_description: Tom Thomson’s jack pine, painted against a background of lake and sky, has come to symbolize the Canadian North. This film outlines the story of Tom Thomson’s brief life (1877-1917) and career, which began in Toronto, where he worked as a commercial artist. Weekend sketching trips in the country turned into longer journeys farther north, and Thomson finally moved to Algonquin Park, in northern Ontario. When he wasn’t painting and canoeing, he was a park guide. We watch wonderful photography of his favourite landscapes, interspersed with images of the paintings they inspired. Thomson spent less than four years as an artist and was barely 40 when a canoe accident ended his life. Fellow artists Lawren Harris, A.Y. Jackson and Arthur Lismer pay tribute to this genius, who, in Jackson’s words, “contributed more to Canadian painting than any other artist.”

results.title: West Side Story
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Seven Arts Productions, Robert Wise and Jerome Robbins
results.brief_description: America, “Tonight”, “Maria”, “Somewhere”, “I Feel Pretty” - just some of the sensational evergreen songs from “West Side Story”, the winner of ten Oscars including Best Picture. Opening with the now famous helicopter shot of Manhattan, “West Side Story” is the heart-rending, brilliantly tuneful contemporary version of “Romeo and Juliet”. The gang rivalry between The Jets and the Puerto Rican Sharks reaches fever pitch when ex-Jet Tony falls in love with Maria, the sister of Shark leader Bernardo. When Bernado is killed in a gang misunderstanding, Tony and Maria become the unwilling, tragic participants in the resulting vendetta. Music by Leonard Bernstein. Starring Natalie Wood as Maria, Richard Beymer as Tony, Russ Tamblyn as Riff and Rita Moreno as Anita. Based on the book by Arthur Laurents.

results.title: West of Pinto Basin. Part II
results.creator_credit: George Weeks, Peak Films and Roy Luby
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part story. The Range Busters solve the mystery of a series of stage-coach robberies. Pleasant, light western. Suitable for children. Cast includes John King, Ray Corrigan. Silent film with English captions.

results.title: West of England
results.creator_credit: Paul Fletcher, Greenpark Productions and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: A picture of the Stroud Valley in Western England where weaving is still the principal industry even as it was hundreds of years ago. The sheep that once grazed there are now gone, and wool is imported from Australia, but rushing streams still provide water power and the weavers still produce fine cloth and maintain pride in their ancient craft.
